parent_formation: No. 244 Wing, No. 211 Group, Desert Air Force
base: LG.85 (August-November), then LG.21, LG.13, LG.155, Gambut West, El Adem, El Magrum (November-December advance)

operations_history.operation: Second Battle of El Alamein - Opening Phase

sources: historyofwar.org - No. 73 Squadron (RAF) during the Second World War
RAF Hurricanes in the Battle of El Alamein - Key Aero (partial access)
Desert Air Force Wikipedia article (organizational context only)
metadata.notes: Tier 2 extraction: 65% confidence. Aircraft strength (16x Hurricane IIC) confirmed from multiple sources. Commander name not found in available sources. Personnel estimates based on standard RAF fighter squadron establishment (16 aircraft = ~150 personnel total). Operations history constructed from general squadron movement records and known battle participation. Squadron recorded 300th victory in December 1942 (F/S Beard shot down Ju 88 over Benghazi). Rapid base movements in November 1942 reflect Allied advance after El Alamein breakthrough.
